ownedComment.body: The allocation repository holding all available allocation contexts of a model.
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>

publish:property.name: Body
publish:property.publish:description: The Body of the Comment
publish:property.publish:value: The allocation repository holding all available allocation contexts of a model.

publish:property.name: Keywords
publish:property.publish:description: Keywords property of the UML element

publish:property.name: Owner
publish:property.publish:description: The Owner of the Element

ownedRule.body: -- Get all AssemblyContexts used by this system, that is -- 1) the AssemblyContexts directly used in the system and self.system_Allocation.assemblyContexts_ComposedStructure -- 2) the AssemblyContexts used by SubSystems in the System. Note that if a SubSystem also contains other Subsystems, -- we need to get those AssemblyContexts too: Thus, we use a closure here ->union(self.system_Allocation.assemblyContexts_ComposedStructure->closure( encapsulatedComponent_AssemblyContext->select(composites|composites.oclIsTypeOf(pcm::subsystem::SubSystem)).oclAsType(pcm::subsystem::SubSystem) .assemblyContexts_ComposedStructure)) --Now, after we collected all AssemblyContexts somehow used, we check whether they need to be allocated --and if yes, if they are allocated. ->forAll(assemblyCtx| --AssemblyContexts that contain SubSystems do not need to be allocated assemblyCtx.encapsulatedComponent_AssemblyContext.oclIsTypeOf(pcm::subsystem::SubSystem) or --All others need to be allocated. self.allocationContexts_Allocation->select(allocationCtx| allocationCtx.assemblyContext_AllocationContext = assemblyCtx)->size() = 1)
ownedRule.name: EachAssemblyContextWithinSystemHasToBeAllocatedExactlyOnce

publish:property.name: Alias
publish:property.publish:description: Alias property of the UML element

publish:property.name: Context
publish:property.publish:description: The Context of the Constraint

publish:property.name: Specification
publish:property.publish:description: The Specification of the Constraint
publish:property.publish:value: <Opaque Expression> -- Get all AssemblyContexts used by this system, that is -- 1) the AssemblyContexts directly used in the system and self.system_Allocation.assemblyContexts_ComposedStructure -- 2) the AssemblyContexts used by SubSystems in the System. Note that if a SubSystem also contains other Subsystems, -- we need to get those AssemblyContexts too: Thus, we use a closure here ->union(self.system_Allocation.assemblyContexts_ComposedStructure->closure( encapsulatedComponent_AssemblyContext->select(composites|composites.oclIsTypeOf(pcm::subsystem::SubSystem)).oclAsType(pcm::subsystem::SubSystem) .assemblyContexts_ComposedStructure)) --Now, after we collected all AssemblyContexts somehow used, we check whether they need to be allocated --and if yes, if they are allocated. ->forAll(assemblyCtx| --AssemblyContexts that contain SubSystems do not need to be allocated assemblyCtx.encapsulatedComponent_AssemblyContext.oclIsTypeOf(pcm::subsystem::SubSystem) or --All others need to be allocated. self.allocationContexts_Allocation->select(allocationCtx| allocationCtx.assemblyContext_AllocationContext = assemblyCtx)->size() = 1)

publish:property.name: Template Parameter
publish:property.publish:description: The Template Parameter of the Parameterable Element

publish:property.name: Visibility
publish:property.publish:description: The Visibility of the Named Element

ownedComment.body:
Each Assembly of BasicComponents and CompositeComponents used in the referenced System must be allocated.
Things are complicated by the introduction of SubSystems. Here, the Assembly of the SubSystem itself does not have to be allocated. If it is not allocated, all BasicComponents and CompositeComponents contained in this SubSystem (also transitively over several nested and not-allocated SubSystems) need to be allocated.
The constraint is realised wth a closure over the AssemblyContext contained in a ComposedStructure.
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>

publish:property.name: Body
publish:property.publish:description: The Body of the Comment
publish:property.publish:value: Each Assembly of BasicComponents and CompositeComponents used in the referenced System must be allocated. ...
